page.title: 19Social Concerns
page.content: Farmers are concerned about sheep worrying. During hard winters they complain that after roads have been cleared so that they can get to stock sightseers come and re-block the roads. Low-flying aircraft also disturb stock but there is a compen- sation scheme. Generally people are unhappy about the reprocessing plant at Sellafield from which the prevail- ing winds could carry pollution. The decision to move local television news coverage from Newcastle to Manchester is regarded as an unwarrented separation from the NE area with which there is a natural affinity. There is local lobbying against the closure of the Carlisle - Settle railway line. The double layer of planning permission (Allerdale District Council & Lake District Planning Board) is a source of irritation.
